questions.question: The longest recorded rally in a tennis match lasted for 29 minutes.
Tennis balls were originally black in color.
The fastest serve in tennis history reached a speed of 163 miles per hour (263 kilometers per hour).
Tennis was originally played with bare hands.
The largest tennis racket ever made was 10 feet (3 meters) in length.
A professional tennis match once took place on top of a moving train.
The first game of tennis was played in a monastery courtyard.
The highest recorded number of tennis balls held in one hand is 22.
Tennis was originally called 'sticky wicket' before adopting its current name.
The largest tennis court ever built was the size of six standard courts.
A tennis match once took place on an aircraft carrier deck.
The longest recorded match of tennis lasted for 11 days.
The first tennis balls were filled with feathers.
The first tennis racket was made of solid wood.
Tennis was once an Olympic event for synchronized pairs.
The first official tennis tournament was held in a ballroom.
Tennis was originally played with a square-shaped ball.
The highest recorded number of tennis balls caught in one minute is 12.
Tennis was banned in some countries for being too 'distracting.'
The first tennis net was made of silk threads.
